name: Sautéed Corn With Chorizo, Cilantro, and Lime Juice
description: I could write an entire book just about the things that go well sautéed with sweet summer corn. I'm serious about that. And with that in mind, it seemed like a no-brainer to include corn as part of our Easiest Summer Ever collection of four-ingredient, no-fuss recipes. Here, we sauté it with Spanish chorizo, cilantro, and lime juice.
recipeIngredient: 4 ounces Spanish-style dry-cured chorizo, cut into 1/2-inch dice
4 cups fresh corn kernels, cut from 4 to 5 cobs of corn
1/4 cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chorizo and olive oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet and cook over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until chorizo has rendered most of its fat and is crisp all around, about 5 minutes. Add corn, increase heat to high, and cook, stirring and tossing frequently, until corn is cooked through and deeply browned in spots, about 4 minutes. Stir in cilantro and lime juice and season with salt and pepper. Serve.
